items.prompt: Given a motor with stall torque 2 N·m and no-load speed 5000 rpm, choose a gear ratio to achieve ~10 N·m output torque and estimate resulting speed.
items.solution: Torque multiplies by ratio; 10/2 = 5:1 ratio. Speed reduces to ~1000 rpm (ignoring losses).

items.prompt: Derive v = (r/2)(ω_r + ω_l) and ω = (r/L)(ω_r - ω_l) for differential drive.
items.solution: From wheel rolling constraints and geometry, sum and difference of wheel angular velocities yield linear and angular velocities.
